title: Paul’s Smoked Duck Salad
abstract:
It’s not really MY turn to do a Cooks’ Column, but one of the Cooks Team has gone missing in action . . . well, no, she’s really just escaping for some round-Victoria tripping while the beautiful autumn lasts.
Himself and I have renewed a friendship with a couple from over Shepparton way through a love of ‘going fishing’. Well, that is: the men love to go fishing, and the women love eating any fish caught. I guess that’s pretty universal, but this fellow has fishing down to a fine, adjusted, educated skill and is willing to share the knowledge with Himself.
(All of which reminds me of a story about a local who was telling me he’d had no luck - been fishing all day. ‘Where did you go?’ I asked. ‘Down the footy ground,’ was his reply. . . I don’t need to tell you that the only water in sight at the footy ground is the swimming pool!)
Anyway, back to our REAL fisherman: he’s also a shooter who treats his hunting the same way as his fishing, taking only what’s permitted, returning undersized fish to the water etc. But he presented us with two home-smoked duck breasts and the recipe how to use them in a salad. Ready?
ingredients: 1 green pear cored and cut into wedges
method: Dry roast walnuts in a dry pan.
Cool and rub off loose skin.
Put prepared pear onto a hot, oiled griller plate so it gets good-looking grill lines on it, turn and grill other side.
Mix salad dressing ingredients well, season with salt to taste.
Combine all the ingredients and dress with enough vinaigrette to coat the salad.
sidebar: We loved the salad so much that I tried another version the next night (which is the one in the photo). No more duck breasts. We ate this salad with a barbecued lamb chop! But the combination of the grilled walnuts and pear is just so divine. I added home-grown tomatoes and some ricotta cheese.
